TopicTitle: The "heat shields are for dummies" re-entry method.

Articles.Content:
This method is clearly an exploit of the new flaps, but still, it's effective.

We start with an 1M Kms re-entry orbit. It should be enough to burn anything unprotected (to be honest, I did not test if it indeed burn and destroy a naked pod, but it should)

![8C4B8A129CF98EF76D14C9F6AE890A3FE5551B5F](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/535143770352298132/8C4B8A129CF98EF76D14C9F6AE890A3FE5551B5F/)

The re-entry pod and its elegant design (cheap, cheap, and cheap). The ablative shield is here to demonstrate that we don't need it.

![8B8C09CAFFE22E1D6221CDB1AA777567141FED87](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/535143770352298825/8B8C09CAFFE22E1D6221CDB1AA777567141FED87/)

Just before re-entry (a bit after in fact, but the serious part is still below us). Around 2500 m/s, could be faster, but as a demonstrator, it should be enough.

![C6B0F6BD54B5EEE796226BD61F8C92523DBBE907](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/535143770352299037/C6B0F6BD54B5EEE796226BD61F8C92523DBBE907/)

And the same 29 seconds, 30000 m and 2300 m/s later (quite a break bump). And still ablator is still at full capacity.

![36D84D9D928F78F7CBC9CA00A57C12B23DA70BD5](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/535143770352299228/36D84D9D928F78F7CBC9CA00A57C12B23DA70BD5/)

And to conclude, the mission report

![9B627D862FCC5D6DFB6E39DD6BC50592718900CD](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/535143770352299646/9B627D862FCC5D6DFB6E39DD6BC50592718900CD/)
